page.title: 10A HERDSMAN OF OFFHAM, SUSSEX
page.content: The farm at Offham, near Arundel is run by a herdsman, his wife, elder daughter, and when not at school, a younger daughter. The tenant farmer lives elsewhere. This family works seven days a week, all day. They never have a holiday for 'someone must always be on hand'. Only the youngster gets a break - a week with Granny in Worthing. The farm has eighty head of cattle, which are taken down the lane, over the occupation bridge, to graze beside the Arun. The husband has a car, the women use bikes. Offham has neither church nor shop nor social activity. Television and the phone are their link-line. The wife seemed content to talk though obviously on her way to the sheds. 'Those who live here like it quiet - we love it, we couldn't live different, - it's so very peaceful.'
